title: Calories in Tamales
meta_description: Discover calories in tamales, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat per serving, plus tweaks and FAQs for better understanding.
assumptions: Standard pork tamale, corn masa dough, filled with pork and chili, steamed; approx. 142 g each, no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by filling (pork, chicken, veggie), size, brand, and preparation method. Check labels for packaged varieties.

quick_answer.text: One standard pork tamale has about 223 kcal, with 25 g carbs and 8 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version (bean filling instead of pork)

faqs.q: How many calories in one tamale?
faqs.a: About 223 kcal for a standard pork tamale.
Yes, mainly from corn masa; one tamale has ~25 g carbs.
Around 8 g per pork tamale, higher with meat fillings.

faqs.q: Do tamales have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, often ~450 mg per tamale due to seasonings.

faqs.q: How do chicken tamales compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar to pork, around 200-230 kcal; leaner meat may reduce fat slightly.
